name: mick
text: Simply beautiful.

name: wharfrat
text: A comment left by wharfrat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by doinkydoink, chomopomomofo, FeralChicken, DHCJohn, PoodleLucy, sumisueme)

name: centipede_damascus
text: I still don't know if that old man is real or just an illusion brought on by Philipe's hunger and fear.

name: featurelessvoid
text: He's real.  This is the super-secret ice cream shop, after all.

name: apocowarg
text: I cannot think of any job I'd rather have. Provided the super secret ice cream shack had a decent internet connection.

name: wittyname
text: I can't see how having a super secret business could be very profitable.

name: apocowarg
text: I would imagine the shop would be funded by a slighty mad billionaire. Once every third year on the second tuesday of tenth month, he would charter a jet to bring no more than seven children to the ice cream shack. Speaking would be strictly forbidden and the only sound would be a phonograph playing a scratchy record by a band whose last member died in 1938.

name: wurlitzergirl
text: You are my hero for thinking of this before me.

name: squares
text: 6 months before you!

name: wurlitzergirl
text: I also somehow think of [url=http://www.last.fm/music/Lionel Belasco/_/Miranda?autostart/]this song[/url]

name: wurlitzergirl
text: Dangit [url]http://www.last.fm/music/Lionel Belasco/_/Miranda?autostart/[/url]

name: shortside40
text: And if any of those seven children were caught playing Imagination Games, well, you know what would happen to them.

name: kledermans
text: Were it not for the snoring I would have thought that the old guy was dead.

name: tomsonlocal
text: A comment left by tomsonlocal was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zeal, jollysaintpete, Wulvaine, yingkaixing)

name: twohundredninety
text: It might be a seltzer tap. He would have a variety of syrups on hand to flavor it with.

name: tomsonlocal
text: A comment left by tomsonlocal was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zeal, norm, jollysaintpete, Wulvaine)

name: relaxing
text: it is an ice cream shop ok

name: charchar
text: You take the seltzer, and you mix in the syrup to make Coca-Cola, pepsi, cherry floats, root beer, shakes.  Think soda jerks.  No beer involved.

name: cracklewater
text: There's a beer on sale with an alcohol content of 43% Not sure how syrupy it is (considering how hard it would be to drink anyway), but that might work as a soda-fountain beer.

name: hyetal
text: You can still hear the rain in panels 3 and 4, drumming on the roof, running off the edge and splashing in the mud.

name: senseihollywood
text: The key to a successful ice cream shop? Location, location, location...

name: deusoma
text: The thing I like about this strip is that "The Super Secret Ice Cream Shop" wasn't just something Pete said to trick Phillipe into going with him. I mean sure, he probably still intends to murder him, but there it is: a damned ice cream shop in the middle of nowhere.

name: gussiejives
text: Hully crap, it's Wilford Brimley!

name: laserblade
text: Which is weird, considering that if anything contributes to diabeetus, it's ice cream.

name: achilleselbow
text: Anyone else think of The Shining?

name: relaxing
text:
What'll it be, sir?
Hair of the dog that bit me.
Bourbon on the rocks?
That'll do her.

name: brokeaccount
text:
The Shining is the only book that ever left me too terrified to walk into my own bathroom.

PROPS, MR. KING.

name: canusdivinus
text: Philippe is just as shocked as you all are. He thought he was a goner, too.

name: wilbur
text:
Man, those slanted raindrops make everything chaotic and terrifying for the last two strips, and then the reassuring vertical lines of the shop make the world turn out all right in the end.

It's brilliant is what I'm saying.

name: poodlelucy
text: it's all so damned neat and orderly there, nothing bad can happen; all the creepiness vanishes in a small little *poof*

name: carlyle
text: I... uh, I... Don't... understand?

name: karljw
text:
what gets me about this arc is that when nice pete says he's going to take phillipe to a "super-secret ice cream parlor," the reader instantly sees past this feeble lie, knowing that all that's in store for phillipe is an early grave. only later do we realize nice pete was in fact telling the truth, and that nice pete is the kind of person for whom secret ice cream and infanticide are not necessarily mutually exclusive.

this is my favorite arc.

name: karljw
text: sorry for misspelling philippe.

name: duperando
text: I love how even Philippe seems surprised that it's ACTUALLY a super-secret ice cream shop and not some jank old murderin' place.

name: shortside40
text: I'm reading through this arc while at work and it has me so unnerved that when a co-worker called my name, I jumped in my seat.  Creepiest part: the coworker's name is Pete and when I replied to him, I stuttered because I almost called him Nice Pete.
